title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Access Control vulnerability that could result in a Security feature bypass. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass security measures and gain unauthorized access. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-34107
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb24-40.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r7cm-g469-wm4g
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Open Source Improper Access Control vulnerability

items.content_html:
A Reflected Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in '/search' in microweber 2.0.15 and earlier allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the 'keywords' parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-40101
  • https://github.com/microweber/microweber/commit/0dede6886c6df3d1f31c4f4e3ba1ab4a336fbf79
  • https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2024/Aug/1
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m99v-mmg2-66vf
items.title: [microweber/microweber] Microweber Reflected Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability

items.content_html:
Microweber 2.0.16 was discovered to contain a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability via userfiles\modules\tags\add_tagging_tagged.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41380
  • https://github.com/microweber/microweber/issues/1111
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hf66-xfgj-42g8
items.title: [microweber/microweber] Microweber Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability

items.content_html:
Cross Site Scripting vulnerability in dcat-admin v.2.1.3 and before allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the user login box.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-29644
  • https://github.com/jqhph/dcat-admin
  • https://www.yuque.com/yangtu-swjrh/oc6nqi/epcbz5y1grl4il1m
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mr24-cf69-5chq
items.title: [dcat/laravel-admin] dcat-admin Cross Site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
Impact

Some of the recent development by Icinga is, under certain circumstances, susceptible to cross site request forgery. (CSRF)

Affected products:

  • Icinga Web (>=2.12.0)
  • Icinga DB Web (>=1.0.0)
  • Icinga Notifications Web (>=0.1.0)
  • Icinga Web JIRA Integration (>=1.3.0)

All affected products, in any version, will be unaffected by this once icinga-php-library is upgraded.

Patches

Version 0.10.1 will include a fix for this. It will be published as part of the icinga-php-library v0.14.1 release.

References

  • https://github.com/Icinga/ipl-web/security/advisories/GHSA-w9pg-7c3h-fc8j
  • https://github.com/Icinga/ipl-web/commit/492336fdb57a5bb0881ed642ab36f5841337571e
  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41811
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-w9pg-7c3h-fc8j
items.title: [ipl/web] ipl/web's `ipl\Web\Common\CsrfCounterMeasure` is susceptible to CSRF

items.content_html:
In Bootstrap starting in version 2.3.0 and prior to 3.4.0, as well as 4.x before 4.1.2, XSS is possible in the collapse data-parent attribute.

items.content_html:
ICEcoder 8.1 is vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting (XSS) via lib/terminal-xhr.php

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41375
  • https://github.com/xjzzzxx/vulFound/blob/main/icecoder/icecoder8.1_xss1.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5j47-3m62-7vr3
items.title: [icecoder/icecoder] ICEcoder vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting

items.content_html:
Webtrees 2.1.18 is vulnerable to Directory Traversal. By manipulating the "media_folder" parameter in the URL, an attacker (in this case, an administrator) can navigate beyond the intended directory (the 'media/' directory) to access sensitive files in other parts of the application's file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-22723
  • https://cupc4k3.medium.com/cve-2024-22723-webtrees-vulnerability-uncovering-sensitive-data-through-path-traversal-7442e7a38b68
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6w5q-79rf-7c49
items.title: [fisharebest/webtrees] Webtrees Path Traversal vulnerability

items.content_html:
Dolibarr ERP CRM before 19.0.2 was discovered to contain a remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability via the Computed field parameter under the Users Module Setup function.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-40137
  • https://github.com/c0d3x27/CVEs/tree/main/CVE-2024-40137
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vprp-94p9-5jp8
items.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr ERP CRM vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE)

items.content_html:
ICEcoder 8.1 contains a Path Traversal vulnerability via lib/backup-versions-preview-loader.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41373
  • https://github.com/xjzzzxx/vulFound/blob/main/icecoder/icecoder8.1_PT.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-x38c-v778-w56m
items.title: [icecoder/icecoder] ICEcoder Path Traversal vulnerability

items.content_html:
Concrete CMS versions 9.0.0 through 9.3.2 are affected by a stored XSS vulnerability in the generate dashboard board instance functionality. The Name input field does not check the input sufficiently letting a rogue administrator hav the capability to inject malicious JavaScript code.

The Concrete CMS security team gave this vulnerability a CVSS v3.1 score of 3.1 with a vector of AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln-metrics/cvss/v3-calculator and a CVSS v4 score of 1.8 with a vector of CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:H/AT:N/PR:H/UI:A/VC:L/VI:L/VA:N/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N Thanks fhAnso for reporting.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-4353
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/pull/12151
  • https://github.com/concretecms/concretecms/commit/ff5a2aba7fbc1ff0368202a2c0afddea47136daf
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3cpf-jmmc-8jm3
items.title: [concrete5/concrete5] Concrete CMS vulnerable to Stored Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
ICEcoder 8.1 is vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting (XSS) via lib/settings-screen.php

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-41374
  • https://github.com/xjzzzxx/vulFound/blob/main/icecoder/icecoder8.1_xss2.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xcr9-pm5w-gvh2
items.title: [icecoder/icecoder] ICEcoder vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting

items.content_html:
A stored Cross-site scripting (XSS) issue in Text Editors and Formats in Backdrop CMS before 1.24.2 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the name parameter. When a user is editing any content type (e.g., page, post, or card) as an admin, the stored XSS payload is executed upon selecting a malicious text formatting option.

NOTE: the vendor disputes the security relevance of this finding because "any administrator that can configure a text format could easily allow Full HTML anywhere."

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-31045
  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/6065
  • https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.24.2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3862-c622-v4fp
items.title: [backdrop/backdrop] Cross-site Scripting in Backdrop CMS
